Sentencas: Sintering of ceramic films on a solid substrate is an important technology for fabricating a range of products, including solid oxide fuel cells, micro-electronic PZT films and protective coatings There is clear evidence that the constrained sintering process is anisotropic in nature.
Titulo: Predicting sintering deformation of ceramic film constrained by rigid substrate using anisotropic constitutive law

Sentencas: This paper presents a study of the constrained sintering deformation using an anisotropic constitutive law.
Titulo: Predicting sintering deformation of ceramic film constrained by rigid substrate using anisotropic constitutive law

Sentencas: The state of the material is described using the sintering strains rather than the relative density.
Titulo: Predicting sintering deformation of ceramic film constrained by rigid substrate using anisotropic constitutive law

Sentencas: In the limiting case of free sintering, the constitutive law reduces to a conventional isotropic constitutive law The anisotropic constitutive law is used to calculate sintering deformation of a constrained film bonded to a rigid substrate and the compressive stress required in a sinter-forging experiment to achieve zero lateral shrinkage The results are compared with experimental data in the literature.
Titulo: Predicting sintering deformation of ceramic film constrained by rigid substrate using anisotropic constitutive law

Sentencas: It is shown that the anisotropic constitutive law can capture the behaviour of the materials observed in the sintering experiments.
Titulo: Predicting sintering deformation of ceramic film constrained by rigid substrate using anisotropic constitutive law
